variable.name: g608
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Are your fingers unusually sensitive to cold, now or in the past?
variable.comment: Instructions for coding variable G608: If asked to define "Unusually" say: "Are they more sensitive to cold than most other people?" G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g609
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do your fingers sometimes show unusual color changes?
variable.comment: Instructions for coding variable G609: If asked to define "unusual", say "Do they become white?" G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g610
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do they become white?
variable.comment: G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g611
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do they become blue?
variable.comment: G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g612
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do they become red?
variable.comment: G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g613
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: What's the palest your fingers even get?
variable.comment: Instructions for coding variable G613: Show color scale. If hesitating between box #1 and box #2, ask "Do they become completely bloodless?" G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g614
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do you hands ever look like any of these 5 pictures? - Photos A
variable.comment: Instructions for coding variable G614: Show hand photograph A. We want to know whether your fingertips or whole fingers are clearly more white than the rest of your hand. We don't need an exact match. (If there any doubt whether there is true blanching ask whether the fingertips or fingers become completely bloodless.) G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g615
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do you hands ever look like any of these 5 pictures? - Photos 1
variable.comment: Instructions for coding variable G615: Show hand photograph 1 G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g616
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do you hands ever look like any of these 5 pictures? - Photos 2
variable.comment: Instructions for coding variable G616: Show hand photograph 2 G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g617
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do you hands ever look like any of these 5 pictures? - Photos 3
variable.comment: Instructions for coding variable G617: Show hand photograph 3 G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g618
variable.description: Raynaud's Questionnaire: Do you hands ever look like any of these 5 pictures? - Photos 4
variable.comment: Instructions for coding variable G618: Show hand photograph 4 G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.comment: G608 - G623 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Special instructions are given in the annotated form for these variables.

variable.name: g686a
variable.description: Work status - derived
variable.comment: This variable derived from G686. See annotated form and protocol for more information.

variable.name: g686b
variable.description: Occupation code - derived
variable.comment: This variable derived from G686. See annotated form and protocol for more information. Some occupations were grouped to preserve confidentiality. Occupation group 1 includes MD, dentist, lawyer, judge, scientist and research. Occupation group 2 includes psychologist, social worker, mental health counselor, banker, accountant, nurse, medical personnel, police, fire, security, military and clergy (minister, priest, rabbi). Occupation group 3 includes laboratory technician, sales, marketing, insurance, realtor, writer, editor, artist graphic designer, craftsperson, mechanic, skilled labor (e.g. plumber, carpenter, painter, hairdresser), sports pro, coach and exercise instructor . Occupation group 4 includes retail, cashier, factory, assembly, restaurant, food worker and heavy labor (construction, landscaping).
